metadata.title: UI Customization
metadata.category: Building an AI Image Generation App with ImagePlayground

inlineContent.text: Learn how to customize the ImagePlayground experience
with source images and additional options.
Providing reference images to ImagePlayground
can yield more contextually relevant results.
How Source Images Are Used:
Reference the overall mood of the image
Extract color palette
Reference composition or layout
When you pass a source image to the sheet, users can
create new images based on it.
Use the sourceImage parameter to
provide a reference image.
Select an image from the user’s photo library
to use as a source.
Here’s an example of using a camera-captured image
as a source.
You can customize the title and description
displayed in the sheet to match your app’s context.
This helps clearly convey the purpose
of image generation to users.
Set the sheet’s top title with the title parameter.
Provide contextual titles that match your app’s features.
Consider the design of buttons or UI elements
that invoke ImagePlayground.
Recommendations:
Use Apple’s Image Playground icon (recommended)
Provide clear action labels
Include appropriate descriptions for accessibility
You can use the
symbol
from SF Symbols.
Here’s the standard Image Playground button design.
Use the official icon from SF Symbols.
Provide various button style options.
Choose according to your app’s design language.
Here’s how to provide Image Playground
from a context menu.
Here’s how to provide multiple concepts as an array.
Here’s an advanced pattern for dynamically creating concepts.
Combine concepts based on user input or app state.
Here’s a complete customization example.
Combine all options for the optimal experience.
You can effectively combine multiple concepts
to generate complex images.
Text concepts + styles
Extracted concepts + source images
Combinations of multiple text concepts
Concepts are applied in order,
with the first concept being reflected most importantly.
Source images are used as visual references
for the generated image,
helping achieve more appropriate results.
Generate more contextually relevant results by referencing the image’s mood, colors, and composition
Apply filters by copying the source image directly
ImagePlayground is a tool for generating new images,
not a filter app.
Automatically extract text from the source image
OCR is not a feature of ImagePlayground.
What advantage does providing a source image to ImagePlayground offer?
photo.fill
This symbol is more suitable for a photo library.
apple.image.playground or wand.and.stars
apple.image.playground is the official symbol,
and wand.and.stars is also a good alternative
that suggests AI generation.
pencil
The pencil icon is more suitable for editing features.
What SF Symbol is appropriate for an ImagePlayground button?
The first concept in the array
Concepts are weighted in order,
with the first concept being reflected most importantly.
Order matters, not text length.
The concept with the longest text
Different weights are applied based on order.
All concepts are applied with equal weight
When providing multiple concepts, which one is reflected most importantly?

doc://imageplayground.HIGImagePlayground.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to ImagePlayground & Apple Intelligence
Building an AI Image Generation App with ImagePlayground

abstract.text: Learn step-by-step how to integrate AI image generation capabilities
into your app using the ImagePlayground framework in iOS 18.
Learn how to customize the ImagePlayground experience
with source images and additional options.
Learn how to display the image generation UI
using the imagePlaygroundSheet modifier.
Learn about the various image styles provided by ImagePlayground
and how to select them appropriately.
Learn how to check ImagePlayground availability and
handle various error situations.
Learn how to receive and utilize generated images
from ImagePlayground in your app.
Learn how to customize the ImagePlayground experience
with source images and additional options.
Learn about the various image styles provided by ImagePlayground
and how to select them appropriately.
